descendants.content:
7/?

final photo

People are affected by wildfires, homes and businesses are lost. Often there's no time to save anything except yourself and your loved ones.

Here's a photo of people gathered along a shoreline watching as across the lake in the distance their community burns in a wildfire.

Please reduce your use of oil and gas

#ClimateChange

media_attachments.description: People gathered along a shoreline. They are dressed in summer clothing like shorts and t-shirts. They are watching helplessly as their community burns under a night sky glowing with orange flames and smoke. The image of the fire is reflected in the water of the lake.

descendants.content: @Snowshadow People feeling now the burden of #climatechange And it is getting worse day by day, week after week. Next year the same but even worse.

account.note: Katten (Main Coon, Heilige Birman en Europees ras), ICTer, vakfotografie, chemisch analist, wetenschappelijke interesse, mythen & sagen, Sci-Fi, natuur & milieu en pensionato (🇮🇹)

descendants.content:
@osiris_0x7A4

Yes, each fire season here begins earlier, unfortunately this year we didn't get enough snow for it to end.

The climate crisis will kill more people each year world wide, yet the oil and gas executives turn a blind eye.
